an5.49:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an5.49:1.2: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side.
an5.49:2.2: Then a man went up to the king and whispered in his ear,
an5.49:2.3: “Your Majesty, Queen Mallikā has passed away.”
an5.49:2.4: When this was said, King Pasenadi was miserable and sad. He sat with his shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say.
an5.49:3.1: Knowing this, the Buddha said to him,
an5.49:3.2: “Great king, there are five things that cannot be had by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.
an5.49:3.4: That someone liable to old age should not grow old. … Sorrowing and lamenting doesn’t do even a little bit of good … ‘The deed is powerful. What can I do now?’”
